---

### 3. Automation Scripts âœ…

**Three executable scripts created:**

#### `setup_github_repo.sh`
**Purpose:** One-time repository initialization  
**What it does:**
- Configures git (user.name, user.email)
- Initializes git repository
- Creates .gitignore (excludes build artifacts)
- Prepares gh-pages directory
- Creates initial commit
- Shows next steps for GitHub creation

**Usage:**
```bash
./setup_github_repo.sh
```

---

#### `publish_docs.sh`
**Purpose:** Manual documentation publishing  
**What it does:**
1. Rebuilds Sphinx HTML (`make clean && make html`)
2. Updates gh-pages/ directory
3. Commits changes with timestamp
4. Pushes to GitHub
5. GitHub Pages automatically updates

**Usage:**
```bash
# After editing documentation:
./publish_docs.sh

# Output:
# âœ… HTML documentation rebuilt
# âœ… Updated gh-pages directory
# âœ… Changes committed
# âœ… Documentation published!
# View at: https://pdroyTT.github.io/Keraunos_PCIe_TILE/
```

**Time:** ~10 seconds to rebuild and publish

---

#### `auto_publish_docs.sh`
**Purpose:** Continuous automatic publishing  
**What it does:**
- Watches for changes in `docs/*.md` and `doc/*.md`
- Automatically rebuilds HTML when changes detected
- Commits and pushes to GitHub
- Runs continuously until stopped (Ctrl+C)

**Usage:**
```bash
# Terminal 1: Start watcher
./auto_publish_docs.sh
# Output: Watching for changes...

# Terminal 2: Edit freely
vim doc/Keraunos_PCIE_Tile_SystemC_Design_Document.md
# Save...
# Terminal 1: [14:30:45] Change detected! Rebuilding...
#            [14:30:52] âœ… Documentation published!
```

**Methods:**
- **inotify** (if available): Instant detection, efficient
- **Polling** (fallback): Checks every 5 seconds

---

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions

### For You (pdroyTT) - Repository Owner:

**Step 1: Run Setup Script**
```bash
cd /localdev/pdroy/keraunos_pcie_workspace
./setup_github_repo.sh
```

**Step 2: Create GitHub Repository**

Visit: https://github.com/new

Fill in:
- Repository name: `Keraunos_PCIe_TILE`
- Description: `Keraunos PCIe Tile SystemC/TLM Implementation - Complete Documentation`
- Public (so team can view) or Private (only collaborators)
- **DON'T** initialize with README

Click "Create repository"

**Step 3: Push to GitHub**
```bash
git remote add origin https://github.com/pdroyTT/Keraunos_PCIe_TILE.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
```

**Step 4: Enable GitHub Pages**

1. Go to: https://github.com/pdroyTT/Keraunos_PCIe_TILE/settings/pages
2. Source: Branch `main`, Folder `/gh-pages`
3. Click "Save"
4. Wait 1-2 minutes

**Step 5: Verify**

Visit: https://pdroyTT.github.io/Keraunos_PCIe_TILE/

You should see the documentation landing page!

---

https://pdroyTT.github.io/Keraunos_PCIe_TILE/

## Automatic Updates Workflow

### Your Workflow (as maintainer):

**Option A: Manual (when making batch changes)**
```bash
# 1. Make documentation changes
vim doc/Keraunos_PCIE_Tile_SystemC_Design_Document.md

# 2. Publish when ready
./publish_docs.sh

# Done! Team sees updates in 1-2 minutes
```

**Option B: Automatic (continuous development)**
```bash
# Start auto-publisher (leave running)
./auto_publish_docs.sh

# Now just edit files normally - they auto-publish!
# No need to remember to run publish script
```

## Benefits of GitHub Pages

### For Documentation:

âœ… **Professional Hosting:**
- Fast CDN-backed hosting
- HTTPS enabled by default
- No server maintenance needed
- Free for public repositories

âœ… **Easy Access:**
- Simple URL: `pdroyTT.github.io/Keraunos_PCIe_TILE`
- No authentication needed (if public)
- Works on any device/browser
- Mobile-friendly responsive design

âœ… **Version Control:**
- Every change tracked in git
- Can revert to any previous version
- Commit history shows who changed what
- Pull requests for team contributions

âœ… **Search and Navigation:**
- Full-text search across all docs
- Auto-generated table of contents
- Cross-references work
- Professional formatting

âœ… **Automatic Updates:**
- Push to GitHub â†’ Pages auto-deploys
- No manual file upload needed
- Changes live in 1-2 minutes
- Can auto-publish from local changes
